body: The fundamental quantities of the following are …………
The derived quantities of the following are …………
From the basic quantities: ……………
A common feature in the French, British, and Metric systems is that they all measure …………
The standard meter and kilogram are made from …………
\(𝟎.𝟎𝟎𝟎𝟎𝟎𝟏\) is equivalent to : ……………….
\( 1\ 𝐜𝐦 =\) ……………. micrometer
An electric current of intensity \(\left(𝟕\ 𝐦𝐀\right)\), then, this intensity in \(\left(\mu 𝐀\right)\) equals …………. \( \mu 𝐀 \)
Femtosecond = ………….. microsecond
𝟖𝟔.𝟐 𝐜𝐦 is equal to ……………
A micrometer measured the radius of a thin wire, which was found to be 𝟑 𝛍𝐦. Then the radius of the wire in 𝐤𝐦 equals …………… 𝐤𝐦
If 𝑿=𝟐𝟓𝟎 𝐦𝐬  𝒀=𝟏𝟓𝟎𝟎 𝛍𝐬, then the value of (𝑿+𝒀) equals ……………
The dimensional formula of the volume of a cuboid is ………….
If the measuring unit of a physical quantity is 𝐤𝐠⋅𝐦/𝐬 , then its dimensional formula is ………….
If the dimensional formula of a physical quantity is \(𝐌𝐋^(−𝟑) 𝐓^𝟎\) , then its measuring unit is………….
If the pressure is given by the relation 𝑷=𝑭𝑨 where (𝑭) is the force, (𝑨) is the area thenthe measuring unit of pressure in (SI) system is ………….
If the two physical quantities 𝑨 and 𝑩 have different dimensions, which of the following mathematical operations has a physical meaning? …………
If 𝒙=𝒚𝒛 where the dimensions of (𝒙) are \(𝐌𝐋𝐓^𝟏\) and the dimensions of (𝒛) are \(𝑳𝑻^(−𝟏)\). So,the dimension of (𝒚) is …………
When a constant breaking force is applied to a vehicle moving at speed 𝒗 and the distance 𝒅 moved by the car by the expression \(\left(𝒅 = 𝒌 𝒗^2\right)\). Then, the base units of 𝒌 = …………

If you know the dimensional formula of a physical quantity (𝑿) is \( 𝑳 𝑻^{−𝟏}\). Choose tha mathematical relation that can be used to calculate the physical quantity (𝑿), Knowing that (𝒎) is mass, (𝒅) distance, (𝒂) acceleration, (𝑭) is force and (𝒕) time …………
The best way to judge the accuracy of measurement is through …………

A student measured the length of a wooden bar which is found to be 𝟓𝟎.𝟐 𝐜𝐦, while the actual value is 𝟓𝟎 𝐜𝐦.
 Accordingly, The absolute error = ……………

A student measured the length of a wooden bar which is found to be 𝟓𝟎.𝟐 𝐜𝐦, while the actual value is 𝟓𝟎 𝐜𝐦.
 Accordingly, The relative error = ……………
The relative error in measuring the area of a room is 𝟎.𝟎𝟔 where the actual value of the area is \(𝟑𝟎 𝐦^𝟐\), then the absolute error in measuring this area is ………….

An engineer measured the length of a building which it was found to be 𝟓𝟓. 𝟐 𝐦. If there was an
error of 𝟎. 𝟎𝟐 𝐦, so the probability of the real value of the building’s length is between ...............
Which one more accurate from the following measure ………….
If rod 𝑨 has a length of (𝟐. 𝟑𝟓 ± 𝟎. 𝟎𝟏) 𝐜𝐦 and rod 𝑩 has a length of (𝟓. 𝟔𝟖 ± 𝟎. 𝟎𝟏) 𝐜𝐦, then, rod 𝑩 is longer than rod 𝑨 by ....................

If the mass of a body is (𝟏𝟎 ± 𝟏) 𝐤𝐠 and its velocity is (𝟒 ± 𝟎. 𝟎𝟒) 𝐦/𝐬, then its momentum equals …………..
(Knowing that : 𝐦𝐨𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐮𝐦 = 𝐦𝐚𝐬𝐬 × 𝐯𝐞𝐥𝐨𝐜𝐢𝐭𝐲 )
A rectangle of area (𝑨) that has a length of (𝟔 ± 𝟎. 𝟏) 𝐦 and width of (𝟓 ± 𝟎. 𝟐) 𝐦. Then, the absolute error in measuring the area equals …………… 𝐦

An object has a mass of (𝟐𝟎𝟎𝟎 ± 𝟏𝟎) 𝐤𝐠 and a volume of 𝟎. 𝟏 ± 𝟎. 𝟎𝟎𝟏 \(𝐦^𝟑\). Then the density of the object equals ………… \(𝐤𝐠/𝐦^𝟑\).
(Knowing that: 𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐲 (𝝆) = 𝐦𝐚𝐬𝐬 (𝒎) 𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐦𝐞 (𝑽) )

A student measured the mass of an amount of chemical material, it was found to be (𝟐𝟎 ± 𝟎. 𝟏) 𝐠 then the mass of the material was decreased by (𝟓 ± 𝟎. 𝟏) 𝐠. Then, the relative error in measuring the remaining amount equals ………….

The percentage of error in measuring the mass of a cube is 𝟏. 𝟓 % and the percentage of error in calculating the length of its side is 𝟏 %, so the percentage of error in measuring the density of the cube’s material equals………….
(Knowing that : \(𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐲 = \frac{𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐦𝐞}{𝐦𝐚𝐬𝐬}\) )
If the relative error of the length of a pen is 𝟐 % and the absolute error equals 𝟎. 𝟏 𝐜𝐦, so the possible measured value of pen equal ………….. 𝐜𝐦
The absolute error for the volume of a cube of side length 𝟓 𝐜𝐦 and relative error in estimating its length 0.01 equals …………
The scalar quantity can be fully defined by its …………….
The vector quantity can be fully defined by its …………
One of the scalar physical quantities is …………
All the following are scalar quantities except …………
A unit used to measure a vector quantity is the …………
Which of the following sentences describes a fundamental scalar quantity ?? …………
Which of the following sentences describes a fundamental vector quantity ?? …………
Which of the following sentences describes a derived vector quantity ?? …………
Ahmed covers a distance of 𝟎. 𝟓 𝐤𝐦 from home to school and the same distance back to home. His displacement equals …………
An athlete covers a distance 𝟐𝟓𝟎 𝐦 to the East and then returns 𝟏𝟎𝟎 𝐦 to the West. Thus, the displacement he moves equals ...................
An object moves along the circumference of a circle of radius (𝒓). Its displacement when it moves a half revolution is ……………
A body moves along the circumference of a circle of radius 𝒓. If it completes four revolutions, so, its displacement is ………….
An object moves along the circumference of a circle of radius 𝝅 if the object covered \( 𝟑/𝟒 \) of a revolution, then the displacement will be ………….

The magnitude of the displacement of a body moving along the circumference of a circle when it completes 𝟏/𝟒 of a revolution is …………. the magnitude of its displacement when it complete 𝟑/𝟒 of a revolution.
An object moves along the circumference of a circle of radius 𝒓. The ratio between the distance covered by it and its displacement during 𝟏Τ𝟐 of a revolution is ……………
A clock, the length of the hand of seconds is 𝟏𝟒 𝐜𝐦, it rotates for 𝟏𝟓 𝐬𝐞𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐝, then the distance covered by the tip of the hand is equal to ………… 𝐜𝐦

Two forces act on the same body, one of them \(𝐹_𝟏\) is in the direction of north and its magnitude is 𝟗 𝑵 and the other \(𝐹_𝟐\) is in the direction of west and its magnitude is 𝟏𝟐 𝑵 then the magnitude of the resultant of the two forces F equals ………….
Two perpendicular forces acting on the same point, their magnitudes are  \(𝐹_𝑥 = 𝟖\ 𝐍\) and \(𝐅_𝐲 = 𝟔\ 𝐍\), so the magnitude and direction of the resultant force is ...........................
A force of 𝟏𝟎𝟎 𝑵 acting on a body, that makes an angle of 𝟔𝟎° with the horizontal, find (\(𝐹_𝑥\) and \(𝐹_𝑦\)).
If the magnitude of the two vectors 𝑨 and 𝑩 are 𝑨 = 𝟏𝟎 units and 𝑩 = 𝟐𝟎 units and the angle between them is 𝟔𝟎°, then the scalar product of the two vectors equals ……………
There are two vectors 𝑨 and 𝑩, where 𝑨 = 𝟖 𝐜𝐦 and 𝑩 = 𝟐 𝐜𝐦 and the angle (𝜽) between them is 𝟑𝟎°, then the magnitude of their vector product equals ……………. 𝐜𝐦.
The scalar product of two vectors becomes maximum when the angle between them is ………….
The magnitude of the vector product of two vectors vanishes and, also their resultant vanishes, when the two vectors have the same magnitude and the angle between them is …………
If the vector product of two vectors 𝑨 ∧ 𝑩 = 𝑪, then 𝑨 ⋅ 𝑪 = ……………..
A force (𝑭) makes angle 𝜽 with the horizontal, when …………. its horizontal component \(𝑭_𝒙\) will be greater than its vertical component \(𝑭_𝒚\).
If the angle between two vectors 𝑨 and 𝑩 is 𝜽 , then = [(𝑨 ∧ 𝑩) + (𝑩 ∧ 𝑨)] = ………………
Vector 𝑨 has magnitude 𝟓 units and vector 𝑩 has magnitude 𝟒 units, then the magnitude of the resultant of the two vectors 𝑨 and 𝑩 can not be equal to …………. units.
Two equal vectors of the same type have scalar product of 𝟐𝟓 units, then the magnitude of their resultant equals ………… units
If the angle between the two vectors 𝑿 and 𝒀 is 𝟒𝟒°, then the ratio between the magnitude of their vector product and their scalar product is …………..
The magnitude of two perpendicular vectors are 3 units and 𝟓 units. If the vertical vector rotates by 𝟔𝟎°, then the vectors product of the two vectors is ………. \(\hat{𝒏}\).

Two forces act on the same body, one of them \(𝐹_𝟏\) is in the direction of north and its magnitude is 𝟗 𝑵 and the other \(𝐹_𝟐\) is in the direction of west and its magnitude is 𝟏𝟐 𝑵 then the magnitude of the resultant of the two forces F equals ………….
Two perpendicular forces acting on the same point, their magnitudes are  \(𝐹_𝑥 = 𝟖\ 𝐍\) and \(𝐅_𝐲 = 𝟔\ 𝐍\), so the magnitude and direction of the resultant force is ...........................

If the magnitude of the two vectors 𝑨 and 𝑩 are 𝑨 = 𝟏𝟎 units and 𝑩 = 𝟐𝟎 units and the angle between them is 𝟔𝟎°, then the scalar product of the two vectors equals ……………
There are two vectors 𝑨 and 𝑩, where 𝑨 = 𝟖 𝐜𝐦 and 𝑩 = 𝟐 𝐜𝐦 and the angle (𝜽) between them is 𝟑𝟎°, then the magnitude of their vector product equals ……………. 𝐜𝐦.
The scalar product of two vectors becomes maximum when the angle between them is ………….
The magnitude of the vector product of two vectors vanishes and, also their resultant vanishes, when the two vectors have the same magnitude and the angle between them is …………
If the vector product of two vectors 𝑨 ∧ 𝑩 = 𝑪, then 𝑨 ⋅ 𝑪 = ……………..
A force (𝑭) makes angle 𝜽 with the horizontal, when …………. its horizontal component \(𝑭_𝒙\) will be greater than its vertical component \(𝑭_𝒚\).
If the angle between two vectors 𝑨 and 𝑩 is 𝜽 , then = [(𝑨 ∧ 𝑩) + (𝑩 ∧ 𝑨)] = ………………

Two equal vectors of the same type have scalar product of 𝟐𝟓 units, then the magnitude of their resultant equals ………… units
If the angle between the two vectors 𝑿 and 𝒀 is 𝟒𝟒°, then the ratio between the magnitude of their vector product and their scalar product is …………..

A small aircraft had departed the airport. After a while, the pilot reported to the airport tower that the craft was at 𝟐𝟏𝟓 𝐤𝐦 away in a northern east direction that males an angle 𝟐𝟐° to the east. How far was the craft from the tower to the east and the north?
Which of the following is considered a translational motion? …………..
The simplest form of motion is ……………
All the following are periodic motion, except …………… motion.
The rate of change of displacement at a given instant is called the …………..
The ratio between the total displacement and the total time is ………….
Velocity is considered as a ………..
Speed is considered as a …………..
A child threw a stone in the river. Then the magnitude of the stone velocity as it hits the water surface is ………….
If the displacement of a moving body is 𝟑𝟎 𝐦 during 𝟏𝟎 𝐬, then the velocity of the body equals …………
If a car is moving in a straight line to cover a distance of 𝟑𝟎𝟎 𝐦 in a minute, the car velocity is ……………
A leopard was chasing a prey, if it moves by a uniform velocity of 𝟏𝟎 𝐦/𝐬 during 𝟏𝟓 𝐬, then its displacement is …………..
A man is running along a rectangular path of dimensions 𝟓𝟎 𝐦 and 𝟒𝟎 𝐦. If he completes one revolution in a time of 𝟏𝟎𝟎 𝐬, then his average velocity equals …………..
A student left his home at 𝟖: 𝟎𝟎 𝐀𝐌 to go to the school which is 𝟏. 𝟓 𝐤𝐦 from his home. If he arrived at the school at 𝟖: 𝟒𝟓 𝐀𝐌, find his average speed in 𝐤𝐦/𝐡?

The Earth orbits the sun in a roughly circular path to complete one revolution in 𝟑𝟔𝟓. 𝟐𝟓 days, if the radius of the Earth’s orbit is 𝟏. 𝟓 \(\times 𝟏𝟎^{𝟏𝟏}\) 𝐦, then its average speed around the sun equals …………….
Sound travels at an average speed of 𝟑𝟒𝟎 𝐦/𝐬. Lightning from a distant thundercloud is seen almost immediately. If the sound of thunder reaches the Earth 𝟑 𝐬 later, how far away is the storm?
If a car covered 𝟑𝟎 𝐤𝐦 in the south direction during 𝟎. 𝟓 𝐡, then it covered 𝟒𝟎 𝐤𝐦 in the east direction during 𝟐. 𝟓 𝐡, so, the average velocity of the car equals ………… 𝐤𝐦/𝐡
If a car covered 𝟑𝟎 𝐤𝐦 in the south direction during 𝟎. 𝟓 𝐡, then it covered 𝟒𝟎 𝐤𝐦 in the east direction during 𝟐. 𝟓 𝐡, so, the average speed of the car equals ………… 𝐤𝐦/𝐡
If a body moves along a curved path, the ratio between its average speed and its average velocity will be …………..
An object moves along the circumference of a circular path that has a radius 𝒓. When the body makes half a cycle, the ratio between its average speed and its average velocity is ……………
There is a graph that represents the relation between the displacement and time, if it represents a curve, therefore it is considered as …………
A body is moving with a uniform velocity of 𝟓 𝐦/𝐬 for 𝟓 𝐬, then its acceleration equals ………..
In positive acceleration …………..
When the object’s acceleration is in the opposite direction to its velocity, its …………..
If both the direction of velocity and acceleration are negative, ……………
If an object starts motion from rest and speeds up at a constant rate till its velocity becomes 𝟓𝟎 𝐦/𝐬 during 𝟏𝟎 𝐬, this motion is at an acceleration of …………….
Then the change in the velocity of a body that is affected by an acceleration 𝟒 𝐦/\(𝐬^𝟐\) during 𝟐 𝐬 is …………
A man starts his motion from rest with a uniform acceleration of 𝟏 𝐦/𝐬𝟐. If his average velocity is 𝟏 𝐦/𝐬, then the time of his motion is ……………..
A car took 𝟒 𝐬𝐞𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐝 to have a velocity nine times its initial velocity. The acceleration of its motion is numerically equal to ……………… its initial velocity.
A body car start its motion from rest with uniform acceleration 𝟒 𝐦/𝐬² through 𝟏𝟎 𝐬, find the Final velocity ?
The initial velocity of a body \(𝒗_𝒊 = 𝟏𝟎 𝐦/𝐬\) and its acceleration 𝒂 = 𝟐 𝐦/\(𝐬^𝟐\), then its displacement after 𝟏𝟎 𝐬 is …………….
A motorcyclist started motion from rest at a uniform acceleration 𝟏. 𝟓 𝐦/\(𝐬^𝟐\). Its velocity has reached 𝟕. 𝟓 𝐦/𝐬 through a displacement of …………….
A plane lands on the runway at velocity 𝟓𝟎 𝐦/𝐬 and then decelerates uniformly at 𝟐 𝐦/\(𝐬^𝟐\), calculate the time taken by the plane to stop completely.
A police officer finds 𝟔𝟎 𝐦 of skid marks at the scene of a car crash. Assuming a uniform deceleration of 𝟕. 𝟓 𝐦/\(𝐬^𝟐\) to a stop, what was the velocity of the car when it started skidding?
A body begins its motion from rest with uniform acceleration and in a straight line to travel a distance 𝟏𝟎𝟎 𝐦 during 𝟓 𝐬. Calculate the magnitude of the acceleration? ................
A body moves according to the relation \(𝒕 = \left[ \frac{𝟏}{𝟐} 𝐯_𝒇 − 𝟑\right] , so its distance covered when its final velocity becomes 𝟏𝟎 𝐦/𝐬 is ……………
A body moves according to a relation 𝒅 = 𝟒𝟎𝒕 − 𝟐\(𝒕^𝟐\) , so the initial velocity and acceleration respectively ……………

The final velocity of a body moving with uniform acceleration is given by the relation: \( 𝒗_𝒇 = \sqrt{𝒗_𝒊^𝟐 + 𝟐𝒂𝒅}\) . If the initial velocity of the body is 𝟔 𝐦/𝐬 and it moves by acceleration 𝟒 𝐦/𝐬², then its velocity is ……………. after it cover a displacement of 𝟖 𝐦.
If an object moves from rest according to the relation \( \frac{𝟐 𝒗_𝒇}{𝒕} = 𝟏 \), then the acceleration by which the object moves by = …………. 𝐦/\(𝐬^𝟐\)
A Body is moving with uniform acceleration according to this relation: \( \sqrt{𝒕 = \frac{𝟐𝒅}{𝟑}\) , so the velocity of the body after 𝟒 𝐬 is ……….

If an object starts motion from rest and takes time (𝒕) which is numerically equal to the magnitude of its uniform acceleration (𝒂) to reach a final velocity of 𝟏𝟔 𝐦/𝐬, the magnitude of its uniform acceleration = ……….

Two bodies start their motion from rest and move in a straight line with uniform acceleration to cover a distance 𝒅. If the time taken by the first body to cover this distance is double the time taken by the second body, then the ratio between the acceleration of the first body and the acceleration of the second body is …………..
A body starts its motion from rest and moves with uniform acceleration to cover a displacement 𝒅 during time 𝒕, so it covers a displacement …………… in time 𝟐𝒕
A car accelerates uniformly from rest to reach velocity (𝒗) and covers distance (𝒅), the velocity of the car when it covers distance (𝟐𝒅) is …………….
A body starts its motion from rest, so, its average velocity equals its acceleration when it is covered a distance equals …………
A body starts its motion from rest and moves with constant acceleration. If its average velocity during 𝟖 𝐬 is 𝟏. 𝟓 𝐦/𝐬, so its instantaneous velocity is ………….. after 𝟑𝟎 𝐬 from starting its motion.
A body starts its motion from rest and moves with uniform acceleration. If its average velocity is 𝟏𝟎 𝐦/𝐬 when it covers a displacement of 𝟐𝟎 𝐦, then its average velocity during 𝟖 𝐬 is ………….
If a body starts its motion from rest and moves in a straight line with acceleration of 𝟓 𝐦/\(𝐬^𝟐\), then ………….

Two cars are moving in the same traffic lane in two opposite directions with a velocity of 𝟐𝟎 𝐦/𝐬 and when the two cars were 𝟐𝟎𝟎 𝐦 apart from each other, the driver of each car saw the opposite car and started to decelerate his car by the same rate, so the two cars should move by acceleration of …………. to avoid crashing.

A train of length 𝟏𝟎𝟎 𝐦 enters a straight tunnel of length 𝟏 𝐤𝐦 with a velocity of 𝟒 𝐦/𝐬. If the train is moving by acceleration 𝟎. 𝟓 𝐦/𝐬𝟐, then the required time for the entire train to leave the tunnel is …………
When an object falls freely, its ……… changes from one point to another.
Two bodies of different materials having the same volume fall freely together from the same height. Which statement describes correctly their arrival on the ground? …………….
If a body falls freely from a building of height 𝒅 where it takes time 𝒕 to reach the base of the building, then the height of the building is given by the relation …………..
The body 𝑨 falls freely from a height 𝒉 towards the ground and at the same instant, the body 𝑩 is projected vertically upwards. If the two bodies meet at height 𝒉/𝟑, then ………….
An object falls freely. Given that (𝐠 = 𝟗. 𝟖 𝐦/\(𝐬^𝟐\)), its velocity 𝟐 𝐬𝐞𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐝𝐬 later becomes …………
An object falls from a tower to reach the ground 6 s later. If the free-fall acceleration is 𝟗. 𝟖 𝐦/\(𝐬^𝟐\), find the tower height ……………..

In an experiment to determine the free-fall acceleration due to gravity using water drops that fall freely, the distance between the tap and the plate base is (𝟏 𝐦). If the time taken by 𝟏𝟎𝟎 drops is 𝟒𝟓 𝐬, find the free-fall acceleration.
